description.narrative:
Isiolo County is located in the Upper Eastern region of Kenya. Livestock production is the mainstay of the predominantly pastoral and agro-pastoral communities. Ordinarily, this is supplemented by subsistence crop production, trade and bee keeping among other economic activities.
Isiolo County is experiencing severe drought condition in all the livelihood zones characterized by among others drying up of key water sources. This is a result of poor performance of long rains in March – May 2016. The situation was worsened by the poor performance of seasonal rains between October- December 2016. No Arid and Semi Arid Land (ASAL) in Kenya received rain in December 2016 and in all cases the amount was depressed and its distribution rated as poor. The National Drought Management Authority (NDMA) early warning reports reveal that the drought status in Isiolo County is alarm worsening, with some areas experiencing emergency food insecurity. The Government declared the on-going drought a national disaster in February 2017.
The foregoing situation calls for emergency interventions to avert a human catastrophe by saving lives as well as alleviating further suffering.
This project will target 1,240 Households comprising of 6,200people (1,120 men , 1,370 women, 1,980 girls, 1,730 boys). It will prioritise population groups most affected by the drought situation who are: women, children and the aged.
